svg.text: We studied the effect of two DS truncated Na(V)1.1 mutants, R222*
and R1234*, on coexpressed wild-type Na(+) channels
Mutations of SCN1A, encoding a neuronal sodium channel, in two
Voltage-gated sodium channels are responsible for the generation and
propagation of action potentials in excitable tissues
We examined the functional properties of four GEFS+ alleles and one
SMEI allele using whole-cell patch-clamp analysis of heterologously
Defects in voltage-gated sodium channel could decrease plasma
membrane conductance to sodium ions in response to depolarizations
and decreased the electrical excitability of gamma-aminobutyric acid
(GABA) interneurons which leads to hyperexcitability resulting in
